name: Marek Chrobak
content: Marek Chrobak's Home Page Marek Chrobak Professor Department of Computer Science and Engineering University of California, Riverside Riverside, CA 92521 Bourns Hall A159C Education and Previous Appointments 1985, PhD in Computer Science, Warsaw University 1985-1987, Assistant Professor, Warsaw University 1987, Visiting Assistant Professor, Columbia University 1987-current, University of California, Riverside Research Interests Algorithms and data structures: on-line algorithms, combinatorial optimization, approximation algorithms, scheduling, radio networks, graph drawing, discrete tomography Theory of computation: automata theory, complexity theory Combinatorics and graph theory Publications: (in dblp) (in Google Scholar) Some Recent Collaborators Marcin Bieńkowski, Wroclaw University, Poland Jarek Byrka, Wroclaw University, Poland Leszek Gąsieniec , University of Liverpool, United Kingdom Łukasz Jeż , Wroclaw University, Poland Jiří Sgall , Charles University, Czech Republic Neal Young, University of California, Riverside Kevin Costello, University of California, Riverside Mordecai Golin, Hong Kong University of Science and Technology Ian Munro , University of Waterloo Rajmohan Rajaraman , Northeastern Universityi Pavel Vesely , Charles University, Czech Republic Christoph Dürr , CNRS and Sorbonne University, France Claire Mathieu , CNRS and IRIF, France Recent Conference Program Committees SOFSEM'23 ALGOWIN'23 WAOA'24 WALCOM'25 SOFSEM'25 PhD Students Current Chao Wu Sunny Atalig Former Huong Luu Miguel Coviello Gonzalez Li Yan Yu-Ting (Claire) Huang Wojciech Jawor Qi Fu John Noga Future At this time I don't know if I will be recruiting new PhD students for Fall'25. Nevertheless, if you are interested in a PhD with a focus on algorithms, you are strongly encouraged to apply. The department is expected to have at least 30 openings for PhD students, and other faculty in the area of algorithms are expected to look for new students. See our poster and the webpage with information about the admission criteria. Teaching Winter 2024: CS 215, Theory of Computation Spring 2025: CS111 Discrete Structures
